mapper.sql: select ro.id, ro.order_no, ro.user_id, ro.user_name, ro.house_id, ro.house_no, ro.repair_type, ro.fault_description, ro.image_urls, ro.urgency_level, ro.appointment_time, ro.order_status, ro.worker_id, ro.worker_name, ro.assign_time, ro.required_finish_time, ro.actual_fault, ro.repair_content, ro.repair_image_urls, ro.repair_cost, ro.parts_replaced, ro.finish_time, ro.acceptance_result, ro.acceptance_rating, ro.acceptance_comment, ro.acceptance_time, ro.rework_count, ro.auto_accept_time, ro.create_by, ro.create_time, ro.update_by, ro.update_time, h.building_id, h.unit_id, b.building_name, u.unit_name from repair_order ro left join house h on ro.house_id = h.id left join building b on h.building_id = b.id left join unit u on h.unit_id = u.id
mapper.select: where ro.user_id = #{userId} and ro.deleted = 0 order by ro.create_time desc
where ro.worker_id = #{workerId} and ro.deleted = 0 order by ro.create_time desc
where ro.order_status = 1 and ro.deleted = 0 order by ro.create_time desc
select count(*) from repair_order where order_status = #{orderStatus} and deleted = 0
select ro.worker_id, ro.worker_name, count(*) as workCount from repair_order ro where ro.worker_id is not null and ro.deleted = 0 group by ro.worker_id, ro.worker_name order by workCount desc
select ro.repair_type as repairTypeName, count(*) as repairCount from repair_order ro where ro.deleted = 0 group by ro.repair_type order by repairCount desc
mapper.update: update repair_order set order_status = #{orderStatus}, update_time = now() where id = #{id}
update repair_order set rework_count = rework_count + 1, update_time = now() where id = #{id}
